slra.simulation

Class Transform

  • java.lang.Object
    • slra.simulation.Transform

  • public class Transform
extends java.lang.Object
    Transform Class This class creates a Transformation matrix which is applied to each vertex position vector in the shader program.
    Author:
    Henry Valentine Based on thebennybox 3D game engine tutorial

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transform()
      Creates a new Transform Object using default up and forward axes
      Transform(Vector3f upAxis, Vector3f forwardAxis)
      Creates a new Transform object and initializes the translation, rotation, and scale vectors to 0

      • Transform

        public Transform(Vector3f upAxis,
                 Vector3f forwardAxis)
        Creates a new Transform object and initializes the translation, rotation, and scale vectors to 0
        Parameters:
        upAxis - : The direction of the objects "Up" Axis
        forwardAxis - : The direction of the objects "Forward" Axis

        Creates a new Transform Object using default up and forward axes

    • Method Detail

      • getTransformation

        public Matrix4f getTransformation()
        Combines rotation, translation, and scale matrices to create and return a single Transformation Matrix.
        Returns:
        transformation matrix

      • setProjection

        public static void setProjection(float fov,
                                 float zNear,
                                 float zFar,
                                 float WIDTH,
                                 float HEIGHT)
        Initializes the projection matrix values
        Parameters:
        fov - : Field of View
        zNear - : Near Clipping Range
        zFar - : Far Clipping Range
        WIDTH - : Window Width
        HEIGHT - : Window Height

      • getProjectedTransformation

        public Matrix4f getProjectedTransformation()
        Combines The Transformation Matrix with the projection Matrix and the Camera Matrices in order to produce the final projection Matrix to be used in the shader.
        Returns:
        Projection Matrix
